[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-09-15 08:07:48.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/cmd/registry.py', 'glance/tests/unit/api/test_cmd.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_client_exceptions.py', 'glance/cmd/api.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/service.py', 'glance/tests/utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_service.py', 'glance/tests/functional/test_client_redirects.py'], 'message': 'Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it calls SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call is
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
As the server socket is closed, all child processes terminates without
completing already running requests and finally the main process
exits gracefully.

In this patch, I have made provision to process SIGHUP and SIGTERM
separately by adding new GlanceProcessLauncher class. SIGHUP signal
is used to reload the glance api/registry configuration files without
restarting the glance Api/Registry service explicitly. If a SIGHUP signal,
is sent to the parent, then each child process will wait until it completes
all running requests before reloading the configuration file and accepting
new requests. New parent/child processes are not spawned; the original
parent/child processes continue to exist. When the child processes are
waiting on existing requests to complete, and in between any new request
is being initiated then, it will not return error immediately to the user.
It will wait until the requests time out and before this request time out
completes, if SIGHUP signal processing is complete and service gets
restarted completely then this request will get processed immediately.

Following parameters wouldn‚Äôt have any effect when the configuration files
are reloaded due to the SIGHUP signal as these are initialized during the
start up of the glance services debug, cert_file, tcp_keepidle, workers,
bind_host, bind_port etc.

Parameters changes like filesystem_store_datadir, filesystem_store_datadirs
etc. will have a immediate effect as it does not depends on the service
start up.

On receiving SIGTERM signal it will simply terminate all the processes.

DocImpact
blueprint:use-common-service-framework

Change-Id: I3011cacc29f9b5c8ea966fce95bbaf49da9f5223
'}]
commit_message:
Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it calls SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call is
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
As the server socket is closed, all child processes terminates without
completing already running requests and finally the main process
exits gracefully.

In this patch, I have made provision to process SIGHUP and SIGTERM
separately by adding new GlanceProcessLauncher class. SIGHUP signal
is used to reload the glance api/registry configuration files without
restarting the glance Api/Registry service explicitly. If a SIGHUP signal,
is sent to the parent, then each child process will wait until it completes
all running requests before reloading the configuration file and accepting
new requests. New parent/child processes are not spawned; the original
parent/child processes continue to exist. When the child processes are
waiting on existing requests to complete, and in between any new request
is being initiated then, it will not return error immediately to the user.
It will wait until the requests time out and before this request time out
completes, if SIGHUP signal processing is complete and service gets
restarted completely then this request will get processed immediately.

Following parameters wouldn‚Äôt have any effect when the configuration files
are reloaded due to the SIGHUP signal as these are initialized during the
start up of the glance services debug, cert_file, tcp_keepidle, workers,
bind_host, bind_port etc.

Parameters changes like filesystem_store_datadir, filesystem_store_datadirs
etc. will have a immediate effect as it does not depends on the service
start up.

On receiving SIGTERM signal it will simply terminate all the processes.

DocImpact
blueprint:use-common-service-framework

Change-Id: I3011cacc29f9b5c8ea966fce95bbaf49da9f5223

commit_message:
Use Launcher/ProcessLauncher to launch services

Currently other openstack projects like nova, cinder, keystone etc.
are using oslo-incubator's service framework to launch the services.
Similar to these projects glance should also use this service
framework to launch the services.

blueprint: use-common-service-framework
Change-Id: Ifaf39ce1d2dfb9a47cb9863421e41e2fe52f4af3

commit_message:
Cinder should use lioadm on Fedora

Fedora has lioadm in since F18. It should be default
for any RedHat based system except RHEL6 based ones.

Change-Id: I469f77cd5a77f9c6bc87e16c6faf5ca9612992ef
(cherry picked from commit 39b28be81733f2dfe899df63739dec6a2dc98cb9)

Currently, the gate is broken due to the newer version of PyKMIP.
This patch adjusts our interface to PyKMIP to support the newer
interface. As I don't have a way of testing against KMIP, this
patch is really just to get our gate working again. Hopefully,
someone using the KMIP secret store can verify and make

Change-Id: I343257f7d5e719e732e17c9c1b4ea4a55ffb672f

commit_message:
Updating secret store plugin to support PyKMIP 0.3.0

Currently, the gate is broken due to the newer version of PyKMIP.
This patch adjusts our interface to PyKMIP to support the newer
interface. As I don't have a way of testing against KMIP, this
patch is really just to get our gate working again. Hopefully,
someone using the KMIP secret store can verify and make
additional changes to properly support the interface on top of
this patch.

Change-Id: I343257f7d5e719e732e17c9c1b4ea4a55ffb672f

commit_message:
Fix race condition between port data received from OVS and port_sync

There is a race condition between port_sync received from L3 service plugin
and port description received from OVS.
A new data structure is used to hold OVS related port description data and attach
it to the port_data from the L3 service plugin when possible.

Change-Id: I9640c70ef2c3a990ea84385de189331eafeaf3bb
Closes-Bug: #1431340

revisions:
[{'number': 37, 'created': '2015-03-12 18:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py'], 'message': 'VMware: fix VM rescue problem with VNC console

The user was unable to access the VNC console after a VM was rescued.

This is solved by refactoring the rescue/unrescue operations. We
no longer spawn a new VM on rescue but attach the original image and
boot from it. On unrescue detach the original (rescue) image.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

UpgradeImpact

Prior to this patch a rescue operation would create a new VM and the
rescue would take place on the new VM. This is prone to an endless
amount of problems. Some of the issues found are:
 - unable to access the VNC console of a rescued instance
 - unstable to suspend or resume a rescued instance
 - rescue with ephemeral disks does not work
This patch now uses an inplace rescue on the same
VM. It is suggested that when upgrading to the latest version to ensure
that users are aware that a rescue during the upgrade may be problematic.
It is suggested that in the upgrade window that the admin prevent instances
being rescued and give sufficient notice to users.

Change-Id: I3218e7edfe0f71626b2930c39dea0fba4d2e69ca
Closes-bug: #1356389
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix VM rescue problem with VNC console

The user was unable to access the VNC console after a VM was rescued.

This is solved by refactoring the rescue/unrescue operations. We
no longer spawn a new VM on rescue but attach the original image and
boot from it. On unrescue detach the original (rescue) image.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

UpgradeImpact

Prior to this patch a rescue operation would create a new VM and the
rescue would take place on the new VM. This is prone to an endless
amount of problems. Some of the issues found are:
 - unable to access the VNC console of a rescued instance
 - unstable to suspend or resume a rescued instance
 - rescue with ephemeral disks does not work
This patch now uses an inplace rescue on the same
VM. It is suggested that when upgrading to the latest version to ensure
that users are aware that a rescue during the upgrade may be problematic.
It is suggested that in the upgrade window that the admin prevent instances
being rescued and give sufficient notice to users.

Change-Id: I3218e7edfe0f71626b2930c39dea0fba4d2e69ca
Closes-bug: #1356389

commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the new
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax in
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

  * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x)
  * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0

Change-Id: I6e85576823fc93ac0b7a7dff06032d71682259ad

commit_message:
Add ability to deactivate an image

This patch provides the ability to 'deactivate' an image by
providing two new API calls and a new image status 'deactivated'.
Attempting to download a deactivated image will result in a
403 'Forbidden' return code. Also, image locations won't be visible
for deactivated images unless the user is admin.
All other image operations should remain unaffected.

The two new API calls are:
    - POST /images/{image_id}/actions/deactivate
    - POST /images/{image_id}/actions/reactivate

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I32b7cc7ce8404457a87c8c05041aa2a30152b930
Implements: bp deactivate-image

commit_message:
Revert "Set default of api_workers to number of CPUs"

This commit breaks Rally jobs introducing race in Neutron.

You can take a look at parent patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164428/
that adds all benchmarks related to neutron to neutron rally job.
Rally job fails

With this revert rally jobs doesn't fail

This reverts commit c65175811baf29e75556045e3b44ab948e02a9c3.

Change-Id: Ife96f2c3fedf93a9d8496bd7170def53747baec2

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2015-03-08 12:59:51.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'labs/tools/get_upstart_logs.sh', 'labs/scripts/test/README.rst', 'labs/scripts/test/launch_instance.sh', 'labs/tools/restore-cluster.sh', 'labs/tools/README.rst', 'labs/tools/test-once.sh', 'labs/tools/repeat-test.sh'], 'message': 'labs: add test script and helpers

Add script launch_instance.sh for basic instance VM tests. The script
tries to deal with a number of failures that have turned up in testing
(e.g., services failing to start, instance not launching).

The changeset includes three scripts in a new tools directory.

1) To run a test once, use test-once.sh:
   $ ./tools/test-once.sh scripts/test/launch_instance.sh

2) To restore (and boot) the cluster to an earlier snapshot, use
   restore-cluster.sh.

   The argument selects the snapshot used for the controller node VM.

   To select the most recently used snapshot:
   $ ./tools/restore-cluster.sh current

   To select the controller snapshot, "controller_node_installed":
   $ ./tools/restore-cluster.sh controller_node_installed

3) To run the same test repeatedly, use repeat-test.sh. The test script
   name is hard-coded (launch_instance.sh). The argument determines
   whether the cluster is rebuilt for each test or if a snapshot of
   the cluster is restored.

   The controller snapshot is hardcoded (controller_node_installed);
   this particular snapshot is of interest because it does not seem to
   result in a reliable cluster.

   Log files are stored in log/test-results. Repeat-test.sh also
   saves log files from each node's /var/log/upstart to help with
   analyzing failures.

   $ ./tools/repeat-test.sh restore

   After running a number of tests, you can get some simple stats
   using a command like this:

   $ grep -h SUM log/test-results/*/test.log|LC_ALL=C sort|uniq -c

Co-Author: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I20b7273683b281bf7822ef66e311b955b8c5ec8a
'}]
commit_message:
labs: add test script and helpers

Add script launch_instance.sh for basic instance VM tests. The script
tries to deal with a number of failures that have turned up in testing
(e.g., services failing to start, instance not launching).

The changeset includes three scripts in a new tools directory.

1) To run a test once, use test-once.sh:
   $ ./tools/test-once.sh scripts/test/launch_instance.sh

2) To restore (and boot) the cluster to an earlier snapshot, use
   restore-cluster.sh.

   The argument selects the snapshot used for the controller node VM.

   To select the most recently used snapshot:
   $ ./tools/restore-cluster.sh current

   To select the controller snapshot, "controller_node_installed":
   $ ./tools/restore-cluster.sh controller_node_installed

3) To run the same test repeatedly, use repeat-test.sh. The test script
   name is hard-coded (launch_instance.sh). The argument determines
   whether the cluster is rebuilt for each test or if a snapshot of
   the cluster is restored.

   The controller snapshot is hardcoded (controller_node_installed);
   this particular snapshot is of interest because it does not seem to
   result in a reliable cluster.

   Log files are stored in log/test-results. Repeat-test.sh also
   saves log files from each node's /var/log/upstart to help with
   analyzing failures.

   $ ./tools/repeat-test.sh restore

   After running a number of tests, you can get some simple stats
   using a command like this:

   $ grep -h SUM log/test-results/*/test.log|LC_ALL=C sort|uniq -c

Co-Author: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I20b7273683b281bf7822ef66e311b955b8c5ec8a

more clear and easy to understand.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-10 16:11:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue_negative.py'], 'message': "Skip test_rescued_vm_detach_volume

This particular test causes LVM to go out to lunch
during scans waiting for timeouts on device files
that are no longer valid.

I submitted a work around to Nova here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159713/
That works around the issue and alleviates the
problem, however there's not enough understanding
of what's actually happening to merge it.

Meanwhile, this sets things in a state where tests take
hundreds of seconds waiting for lvm timeouts, so until
we have a full understanding and can somehow reach a
consensus on how to fix this I propose we skip the
troublesome test for now and quit logging failures
against Cinder for it.

Related-Bug: #1373513

Change-Id: I762da7a9282d15fb2b61f30148fd923db6e9e209
"}]
commit_message:
Skip test_rescued_vm_detach_volume

This particular test causes LVM to go out to lunch
during scans waiting for timeouts on device files
that are no longer valid.

I submitted a work around to Nova here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159713/
That works around the issue and alleviates the
problem, however there's not enough understanding
of what's actually happening to merge it.

Meanwhile, this sets things in a state where tests take
hundreds of seconds waiting for lvm timeouts, so until
we have a full understanding and can somehow reach a
consensus on how to fix this I propose we skip the
troublesome test for now and quit logging failures
against Cinder for it.

Related-Bug: #1373513

Change-Id: I762da7a9282d15fb2b61f30148fd923db6e9e209

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-13 12:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/hacking/checks.py', 'sahara/utils/hacking/import_checks.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Take back upstream checks for import order

Import order checks was removed from upstream after discussion [1].
We want to save it in Sahara and we can do it because we support only
py2.7
NOTE: After moving to 3.x this checks should be removed/modified
[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-December/052519.html

Change-Id: Ie26613c527c46bfd71ef58cb77219644d784f4c3
Closes-Bug: 1429089
'}]
commit_message:
Take back upstream checks for import order

Import order checks was removed from upstream after discussion [1].
We want to save it in Sahara and we can do it because we support only
py2.7
NOTE: After moving to 3.x this checks should be removed/modified
[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-December/052519.html

Change-Id: Ie26613c527c46bfd71ef58cb77219644d784f4c3
Closes-Bug: 1429089

commit_message:
Move cluster template schema definition to is own file

Moving the schema definition to another file allows it to be
imported without unnecessary dependencies. This allows a
default template CLI tool to use the schema for validation
without extra baggage.

Partial-implements: blueprint default-templates
Change-Id: I2fcd8d3c461f11b8f0d387b2a25d91d5de2419a7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-04 15:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/edp-add-spark-shell-action.rst'], 'message': '[EDP] Add Spark Shell Action job type

The EDP Shell action job type allows users to run arbitrary
shell scripts on their cluster, providing a great deal of flexibility
to extend EDP functionality without engine changes or direct cluster
interface. This specification proposes the addition of this job type
for the Spark engine.

Change-Id: Ib0a7659335a207e07f29902978a01bc1a09e27ce
Describes: blueprint edp-add-spark-shell-action
'}]
commit_message:
[EDP] Add Spark Shell Action job type

The EDP Shell action job type allows users to run arbitrary
shell scripts on their cluster, providing a great deal of flexibility
to extend EDP functionality without engine changes or direct cluster
interface. This specification proposes the addition of this job type
for the Spark engine.

Change-Id: Ib0a7659335a207e07f29902978a01bc1a09e27ce
Describes: blueprint edp-add-spark-shell-action

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-13 08:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Explicitly fail if tox failed in run_tests

In some cases tox do not report failed test command
as a failure (exit code different that 0) upstream.
This patch will explicitly report exit code 1 for
function that run tox in case of failed tests.

Change-Id: I639d2c4ac3625ff3832a43e83c46d0e61debe679
Closes-Bug: #1431437
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly fail if tox failed in run_tests

In some cases tox do not report failed test command
as a failure (exit code different that 0) upstream.
This patch will explicitly report exit code 1 for
function that run tox in case of failed tests.

Change-Id: I639d2c4ac3625ff3832a43e83c46d0e61debe679
Closes-Bug: #1431437

commit_message:
Added running pre_provision tasks

We need to build target images before we can use them for IBP. Nailgun
serializes pre-provision tasks and puts them under pre_provision key
in provisioning_info.

Depends on: Ie404388cc3093a20477ea1a9771ef9e9645d17c3
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

Change-Id: I88df9ea250a1541f53d9f6efe0be9f7e189ae97e

commit_message:
Send 'provisioning-images' task to Astute

Since we're going to execute tasks as part of provisioning images we
need to extend format of provisioning_info message.. and in order to
do not break this format for previous releases we have to introduce
versioned provisioning serializers.

Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
Change-Id: Ie404388cc3093a20477ea1a9771ef9e9645d17c3

subject: Use compatible map and update map/reduce task docs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-14 04:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/task.py'], 'message': 'Use compatible map and update map/reduce task docs

Instead of using the map() function (which depending
on the python version may return a list or an iterator
prefer to use the six.moves provided one and convert
that one to a list; this avoids creating extra lists
on versions of python where map() itself returns a
list).

This also adjusts some of the docstring to match the
style and format of other docstrings.

Change-Id: I29212016da95da6ca2bc6b3f103d03f7fcabf032
'}]
commit_message:
Use compatible map and update map/reduce task docs

Instead of using the map() function (which depending
on the python version may return a list or an iterator
prefer to use the six.moves provided one and convert
that one to a list; this avoids creating extra lists
on versions of python where map() itself returns a
list).

This also adjusts some of the docstring to match the
style and format of other docstrings.

Change-Id: I29212016da95da6ca2bc6b3f103d03f7fcabf032

commit_message:
Revert virtual_router support from l23network::l3::ifconfig

because passing any routes broke possibility of specify and
get network parameters by network roles.

!!! This request should be merged together with the nailgun part:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163847/


Change-Id: Idc8d067f6c00aa97c27bf90984d90176796b7644
Partial-bug: #1430774
Closes-bug: #1431935

commit_message:
javelin: fix CONF.compute.use_floatingip_for_ssh usage

In a previous commit, CONF.use_floatingip_for_ssh was used while this
parameter is in fact CONF.compute.use_floatingip_for_ssh so we did not
check floating IP for real.

Change-Id: I9d13bf87981c587691e947447e2f299b9d79a174

commit_message:
Build domain scope for Fernet tokens

This commit makes sure we pass domain_id to get_token_data() for the
V3TokenDataHelper object. Previously, we weren't passing domain_id which caused
missing data in validation responses for domain-scoped tokens.

Change-Id: Ie810ba5d778c2186f699aae5f87ea0ff783e0bf9
Closes-Bug: 1430433

When creating a new service (Base), call dispose

Closes-Bug: #1417018

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy reuse in multi-backend children

Multi-backend breaks because sqlalchemy objects
are shared between child backends.

When creating a new service (Base), call dispose
to reset the sqlalchemy object and connection.

Change-Id: I9d937c5b2fa850edc5523f26e031f59cad5a9e7e
Closes-Bug: #1417018

commit_message:
Set TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env

TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR needs to be set for the api job to execute
successfully.  Previously this was being set by the gate but local
execution required manually setting the variable.

Change-Id: Ic1364388e812a5fca26f37049242f7d09ee75fef

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-03 12:46:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cli/simple_read_only/network/test_neutron.py'], 'message': 'Relax neutron secgroup/rule list CLI check

I proposed patches which improves outputs of neutron security-group-list
and security-group-rule-list [1][2]. In these patches displayed columns
are changed for better human readability, however tempest CLI tests
check table columns strictly and prevents such change.

This commit relaxes the column changes in the related CLI tests
so that the tests check only basic columns.

It is a big question whether we should do such strict check or not.
This may need a discussion, so I only changes the related CLI tests
in this commit and will revisit this after corresponding patches
are merged. (Of course for a long term solution the ongoing effort
to move CLI tests to each client projects is a correct direction.)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160225/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160770/

Change-Id: Ibf89ae46c36f26895856fe55c114701671e520a8
'}]
commit_message:
Relax neutron secgroup/rule list CLI check

I proposed patches which improves outputs of neutron security-group-list
and security-group-rule-list [1][2]. In these patches displayed columns
are changed for better human readability, however tempest CLI tests
check table columns strictly and prevents such change.

This commit relaxes the column changes in the related CLI tests
so that the tests check only basic columns.

It is a big question whether we should do such strict check or not.
This may need a discussion, so I only changes the related CLI tests
in this commit and will revisit this after corresponding patches
are merged. (Of course for a long term solution the ongoing effort
to move CLI tests to each client projects is a correct direction.)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160225/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160770/

Change-Id: Ibf89ae46c36f26895856fe55c114701671e520a8

commit_message:
oslo incubator sync

Import the latest oslo incubator code.
Imported from commit f2cfbba78c0bfb5d48f32d86182f3e39f317ec82

It can be deleted when Horizon consumes policy from openstack_auth.
Until then we need to keep openstack.common.log in the tree.

commit_message:
Pass correct project ID to get tenant_usages

The current implementation of tenant_quota_usages did not allow for
queries regarding projects that were not the currently active project,
this meant that when an admin went to edit or create a project it tried
to verify the usages against the wrong project. This patch adds the
code for passing a project id to the tenant_quota_usages function so
that the usages can be fetched for a specific project, as well as
removes the need for usage validation on creation of a new project.

(cherry picked from commit 193d40a41472adc6c27e18256524afb2dacb9156)

Change-Id: I3ec84d14c8be7e3aae066119e963c4093f8aa345
Closes-Bug: 1380701

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-12-29 15:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/forms.py', 'horizon/utils/validators.py'], 'message': "Allow all printable ASCII characters in security group names

Thus far, the security group name was checked with Django's validate_slug.
Consequently, some characters like spaces (bug #1224576) and @ (bug #1233501) were forbidden.

Now, all printable ASCII characters -- i.e. from 0x20 to 0x7E -- are valid.

CreateGroup and UpdateGroup subclass GroupBase in order to be more DRY.

Closes-Bug: #1224576

"}]
commit_message:
Allow all printable ASCII characters in security group names

Thus far, the security group name was checked with Django's validate_slug.
Consequently, some characters like spaces (bug #1224576) and @ (bug #1233501) were forbidden.
This fix removes validate_slug and provides a less restrictive validation.
Now, all printable ASCII characters -- i.e. from 0x20 to 0x7E -- are valid.
Note that diacritics are disallowed.
On top of that the length is now checked and limited to 255 characters in accordance with Nova.

Security group forms have been factorized in one abstract base class: GroupBase.
CreateGroup and UpdateGroup subclass GroupBase in order to be more DRY.

Change-Id: Ifc8e5f75419a73a353b2138641773d36138ecea8
Closes-Bug: #1224576
Closes-Bug: #1233501

commit_message:
Update hacking check for oslo_log

With commit 5980da5d we moved Cinder to using the olso.log
library.  We also moved to the new oslo_log namespace.  With that
change we should have also updated the hacking checks to include
looking for old uses of oslo.log.

This change adds the necessary hacking check.

Change-Id: I6a5d4b66d3258dbd01543be03810a8f84040e660

commit_message:
Unset gateway in /etc/sysconfig/network

l23network Puppet module, which fuelmenu depends on,
uses gateway configuration from inside ifcfg scripts,
rather than /etc/sysconfig/network. For that reason,
it should be purged within fuelmenu to enable it to
work properly.

Change-Id: I2128f308dc94a26db32c3a6ea23a3d3cd4783640
Closes-Bug: #1430379

commit_message:
Modifying devstack plugin job template

This patch modifies the job template for devstack plugins by
adding '{pipeline}' and '{branch-designator}' to the job name,
and passing those values as part of 'project' definition in
jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml file.

Also modified job name in Cinder, devstack-plugin-glusterfs
project's check pipeline to "check-tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs-nv".

And this patch also creates a new voting job
"check-tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs" for "devstack-plugin-glusterfs"
project.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak C Shetty <deepakcs@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5939b7b5d2fb3cb29f22e38b1aa392d810c0feec

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for flavor_access

This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
flavor_access.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call service_create
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I7195547099d9a8b6d7789885561bb2809234a155

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 17:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['monasca/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Fixing log property

The monasca.conf "log_level" property was not being used on code. The code was
looking for a "debug" flag. This patch enables log_level property allowing
the user to set it as INFO, DEBUG, WARNING or ERROR.

Change-Id: I7f0e8c5b7956f44bd9401b47214e1e29558f329e
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing log property

The monasca.conf "log_level" property was not being used on code. The code was
looking for a "debug" flag. This patch enables log_level property allowing
the user to set it as INFO, DEBUG, WARNING or ERROR.

Change-Id: I7f0e8c5b7956f44bd9401b47214e1e29558f329e

this breaks the Grenade Neutron job. This patch should

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2014-08-06 16:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_neutron_security_groups.py'], 'message': 'Boot an instance with multiple vnics on same network

If the same L2 network is requested multiple times for the same
instance then creating ports on same network and attaching them
to the same instance raises a DuplicateNetworks exception.
Similarly, attaching multiple existent ports on same L2 network
to the same instance raises a DuplicateNetworks exception. This
is the default behavior that is defaulted by a newly introduced
nova flag "allow_duplicate_networks" which is set to
False by default.

Not raising a DuplicateNetwork exception and allowing an instance
to have multiple vnics on same network is useful for NfV service
instances and in that case this newly introduced nova flag should
be set to True.

DocImpact: New neutron.allow_duplicate_networks configuration option
Implements blueprint multiple-if-1-net
Change-Id: Id4d633162c785c9b56b9c8426c0445770bc1352e
Closes-Bug: #1187244
'}]
commit_message:
Boot an instance with multiple vnics on same network

If the same L2 network is requested multiple times for the same
instance then creating ports on same network and attaching them
to the same instance raises a DuplicateNetworks exception.
Similarly, attaching multiple existent ports on same L2 network
to the same instance raises a DuplicateNetworks exception. This
is the default behavior that is defaulted by a newly introduced
nova flag "allow_duplicate_networks" which is set to
False by default.

Not raising a DuplicateNetwork exception and allowing an instance
to have multiple vnics on same network is useful for NfV service
instances and in that case this newly introduced nova flag should
be set to True.

DocImpact: New neutron.allow_duplicate_networks configuration option
Implements blueprint multiple-if-1-net
Change-Id: Id4d633162c785c9b56b9c8426c0445770bc1352e
Closes-Bug: #1187244

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-13 22:45:04.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/server.py', 'taskflow/engines/worker_based/protocol.py'], 'message': 'Use a collections.namedtuple for the request work unit

Instead of returning a tuple with hard to understand
and read contents a namedtuple can help understand what the

commit_message:
Use a collections.namedtuple for the request work unit

Instead of returning a tuple with hard to understand
and read contents a namedtuple can help understand what the
tuple is composed of and how it can be used/what it is,
so we should prefer to use it when we can for the wbe
requested work to perform.

Change-Id: I8147814449d04ba9a03730547ac113e4ef7b272a

commit_message:
Add a log statement pre-validation that dumps graph info

Before validation occurs it can be useful to let the developer
know the number of nodes, the edge count and the density of the
graph that is about to be validated (as huge graphs, or very
dense graphs, or a combination of both) will take longer to
validate.

Change-Id: I7afb15ef617316e561dfdecc5bf05f4c8263d0d1

commit_message:
Have this example exit non-zero if incorrect results

When this examples engine does not produce the expected
results have it exit with a non-zero error code so that
the users knows (and so that the example testing system
fails when this happens).

Change-Id: I8c3b80a7dc1c7ef47d7804526346883b24caabc4

commit_message:
Made project_id required for ec2 credential

ec2 tokens cannot be created without the user and project
associated with the credentials. The project_id must be
required when creating ec2 credentials.

Updating json schema to check:
- if ec2 type, project_id is required
- else, project_id is optional

 Closes-Bug: #1268977

Change-Id: Id7118e028d8c3ff607ac24cd9ecba90a905ce91f

List the avaiable EC algorithms if a unsupported EC algorithms found in
swift.conf

PyECLib provides a module level attribute that containers all the supported
erasure coding algorithms. This patch makes Swift checkes that first before

Change-Id: Ie32f59847ed99e2dbce5b7596637a74cd9758eba

commit_message:
List valid EC types in error

List the avaiable EC algorithms if a unsupported EC algorithms found in
swift.conf

PyECLib provides a module level attribute that containers all the supported
erasure coding algorithms. This patch makes Swift checkes that first before
creating the EC instance.

Change-Id: Ie32f59847ed99e2dbce5b7596637a74cd9758eba
Signed-off-by: Yuan Zhou <yuan.zhou@intel.com>

commit_message:
cells: don't pass context to instance.save in instance_update_from_api

Commit 1cf0890fdd23dbf29d03659ad6e8569b3f6e003f creates a wedge whenever
someone tries to pass a context to a remotable nova object method, like
instance.save().  There was still an occurrence of this happening in
cells so let's clean it up and make cells happy(ish) again.

Closes-Bug: #1431562

commit_message:
Stop spamming logs when creating context

Pass through the rest of the arguments for the oslo_context's
RequestContext class if they are in our constructor's kwargs.
This will prevent us from logging them as arguments that we
drop explicitly.

Closes-Bug: #1431549
Change-Id: Ie804a6117accc0e35ef5cfd31360a79636630e21

commit_message:
Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information

This patch adjusts the method introduced in
I98fb57a56c1b7ddd6558e265cf6e65b159a05123 to trim the debug information
from the ansible output.

This adjustment allows the output to come to the console immediately,
instead of piping to a file and doing the processing after the ansible
run is complete.

Change-Id: I515adcad34ef76b8ea47fe90bc6572fb3aec1d2c
Partial-bug: #1425482
(cherry picked from commit ed090eb1094472dcef755e6ca319310e5a0e7eac)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-13 14:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-lint.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Simplify and improve bootstrap/gate/run scripts

Originally the gate check scripts were built in such a way that they
could cater for all branches with the same script. This no longer needs
to be the case as the gate checks are acknowledged to be
branch-specific.

The necessary bits to cater for the other branches have now be removed
to simplify the scripts.

Also, in master all environment variables are exported, which helps with
ensuring that the variables are present when other scripts are also run.
This is a better practise and has been included in the script clean-up.

Change-Id: Ie678bed2bf3cd35c307f5a2d33d93664022b0cda
Closes-Bug: #1431361
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify and improve bootstrap/gate/run scripts

Originally the gate check scripts were built in such a way that they
could cater for all branches with the same script. This no longer needs
to be the case as the gate checks are acknowledged to be
branch-specific.

The necessary bits to cater for the other branches have now be removed
to simplify the scripts.

Also, in master all environment variables are exported, which helps with
ensuring that the variables are present when other scripts are also run.
This is a better practise and has been included in the script clean-up.

Change-Id: Ie678bed2bf3cd35c307f5a2d33d93664022b0cda
Closes-Bug: #1431361

commit_message:
Rename RUGGEDIZE to SSYNC

RUGGEDIZE was REPLICATION (and still is on master) however is only
used for SSYNC and is also used for EC so we'll just call it SSYNC
to avoid confusion.  Also added a note that REPLICATE for the obj
server is used by both replication and EC and really just does
a get_hashes() at the remote end.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I0a6d554eb3326a5fd3fc41135a8615ec7b24551f

commit_message:
Pre-compute the atom name to atom mapping

Instead of repeatedly search the execution graph
for a atom when a scope is requested just create
a mapping at runtime object creation time of
atom name to atom and then use this when fetching
scope walkers.

Change-Id: I23cd9ea5d5d556b174f6dd6047a9c4d8d6e25cfc

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-13 18:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Break out the child version calculation logic from obj_make_compatible()

This pulls out the child version logic from the compatibility routine,
so that it can be used in other contexts. I left the tests that verify
the versions pointing at the caller to show that this doesn't break
anything. Moving them to actually test the core function would be good.

However, now the inner version calculation logic is a little more
precise, which changed one of the test cases simply because it was
not considering the actual child version properly. That same issue
plagued other cases because we were not properly calling each case on
a clean copy of the primitive (which didn't matter before).

Change-Id: Id4071b6bc6e9d4419e9142fa339095f04b182d92
Related-Bug: #1431201
"}]
commit_message:
Break out the child version calculation logic from obj_make_compatible()

This pulls out the child version logic from the compatibility routine,
so that it can be used in other contexts. I left the tests that verify
the versions pointing at the caller to show that this doesn't break
anything. Moving them to actually test the core function would be good.

However, now the inner version calculation logic is a little more
precise, which changed one of the test cases simply because it was
not considering the actual child version properly. That same issue
plagued other cases because we were not properly calling each case on
a clean copy of the primitive (which didn't matter before).

Change-Id: Id4071b6bc6e9d4419e9142fa339095f04b182d92
Related-Bug: #1431201

commit_message:
API Microversions

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/api-microversions

Add documentation about how Ironic and clients should interact
negotiating which version of the REST API to use.

Change-Id: Ic0474a91532d0d3a1c7067eacdee8749364cbdfa

commit_message:
ML2 cisco_nexus MD: sync config and models with vendor repo

Updates required to the upstream neutron ML2 cisco nexus MD code to
support stackforge repo changes.

Original development done under cisco-openstack repo. File history for
these changes can be found under the staging/junoplus branch.

Change-Id: Idc9da84cefa4131a84b911f77d99a3b1647103a8
Closes-Bug: 1429879

commit_message:
Brocade vendor code decomposition from neutron repo.

Brocade code decomposition of VDX mechanism driver,
includes moving out the driver and unit tests. Left
behind are the DB model for migration and config

Closes bug: #1427793

Change-Id: I3b06a1800cce1ddbb87c6ebd7981e3f249df5060

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}]

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-10 11:51:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/virt/vmware/test_inspector.py'], 'message': "Fixes ceilometer-compute service start failure

Currently ceilometer-compute service is failing to start in the
'vmware' region, because of the additional parameter 'port', is

commit_message:
Fixes ceilometer-compute service start failure

Currently ceilometer-compute service is failing to start in the
'vmware' region, because of the additional parameter 'port', is
added to the oslo.vmware _get_wsdl_loc method.

This patch fixes it by not calling the private method _get_wsdl_loc,
avoiding the mismatch in the method call. Additional optional
'wsdl_location' is added to over-ride to default location for bug
work-arounds.

Test cases are not added, since the changed method just calls the
oslo.vmware and method is already mocked in the setUp of the
class TestVsphereInspection.

for Icehouse,add 'wsdl_location' option to the sample config file
'etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf.sample'

Co-Authored-By: yanheven <yanheven@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1326230
(cherry picked from commit ff5c133cb0f548851a8d276a31c7f38bcc9c5522)
Change-Id: Ib70092c1ccb14421701acdf8ff4a3805becbeef4

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-30 03:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/vsphere_operations.py'], 'message': 'fix the value of samples_cnt

code before:

samples_cnt = (duration / VC_REAL_TIME_SAMPLING_INTERVAL)
if duration else 1)
query_spec.maxSample = samples_cnt

the value of "query_spec.maxSample" will be float type ,which cause problems
when send http request to vcenter.

if we set the value of "interval" in /etc/ceilometer/pipline.yaml to less
than 20,the value of "samples_cnt" will be 0,which will cause problem in
below code:

stat_value = float(sum(metric_series.value)) / samples_cnt

Change-Id: I221f4da3984869df4663e482ffca7e7889088eba
Closes-Bug:#1415307
'}]
commit_message:
fix the value of samples_cnt

code before:

samples_cnt = (duration / VC_REAL_TIME_SAMPLING_INTERVAL)
if duration else 1)
query_spec.maxSample = samples_cnt

the value of "query_spec.maxSample" will be float type ,which cause problems
when send http request to vcenter.

if we set the value of "interval" in /etc/ceilometer/pipline.yaml to less
than 20,the value of "samples_cnt" will be 0,which will cause problem in
below code:

stat_value = float(sum(metric_series.value)) / samples_cnt

Change-Id: I221f4da3984869df4663e482ffca7e7889088eba
Closes-Bug:#1415307

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-13 02:53:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_agent_config.py', 'tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/base.py', 'setup.cfg', 'neutron/agent/common/config.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add rootwrap daemon mode support

This patch introduces support for rootwrap daemon mode. It adds
a new config option, AGENT.root_helper_daemon with no default. To
enable, set to something like:

root_helper_daemon = sudo neutron-rootwrap-daemon /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

The patch currently assumes that the root_helper_daemon value, and specifically
the rootwrap config, will not change once calls to execute() happen. While it
would not be hard to generate a rootwrap daemon client for each new config, I
couldn't think of a legitimate reason to support it and left it out as YAGNI.

This patch does change the behavior of the addl_env argument to create_process
and execute. Previously, an environment dict would be passed to Popen. If
a root helper was used, this environemnt would actually be passed to 'sudo'
which would filter it before passing it to the underlying command. In the case
of daemon mode, this would cause a problem as the enviornment is filtered by
sudo only once, at daemon startup. Any environment variables added at execute
time would then just be passed directly to the underyling command unfiltered.

oslo.rootwrap 1.6.0 fixes this issue by denying the passing of environment
variables to the daemon altogether. Instead, anything using rootwrap and needing
to pass additional environment variables should define an EnvFilter and run the
command with env var=val cmd. utils.execute/create_process have been modified to
run code in this way (which netns.execute already did).

No code in neutron currently uses both run_as_root=True and addl_env, so this
change does not require any change in code or filters.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I567334bb611253c7b9d830d50c5be308a5153baf
"}]
commit_message:
Add rootwrap daemon mode support

This patch introduces support for rootwrap daemon mode. It adds
a new config option, AGENT.root_helper_daemon with no default. To
enable, set to something like:

root_helper_daemon = sudo neutron-rootwrap-daemon /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

The patch currently assumes that the root_helper_daemon value, and specifically
the rootwrap config, will not change once calls to execute() happen. While it
would not be hard to generate a rootwrap daemon client for each new config, I
couldn't think of a legitimate reason to support it and left it out as YAGNI.

This patch does change the behavior of the addl_env argument to create_process
and execute. Previously, an environment dict would be passed to Popen. If
a root helper was used, this environemnt would actually be passed to 'sudo'
which would filter it before passing it to the underlying command. In the case
of daemon mode, this would cause a problem as the enviornment is filtered by
sudo only once, at daemon startup. Any environment variables added at execute
time would then just be passed directly to the underyling command unfiltered.

oslo.rootwrap 1.6.0 fixes this issue by denying the passing of environment
variables to the daemon altogether. Instead, anything using rootwrap and needing
to pass additional environment variables should define an EnvFilter and run the
command with env var=val cmd. utils.execute/create_process have been modified to
run code in this way (which netns.execute already did).

No code in neutron currently uses both run_as_root=True and addl_env, so this
change does not require any change in code or filters.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I567334bb611253c7b9d830d50c5be308a5153baf

The commit bf2ad70 [1] for DevStack, moved lib/config to inc/meta-config
and this breaks the to VPN functional jobs, which source this file in
the gate_hook.sh script.

This is a quick fix to get the jobs working again. A future commit can
consider updating gate_hook.sh (as I see that Neutron repo is using a

commit_message:
Fix functional test breakage from DevStack change

The commit bf2ad70 [1] for DevStack, moved lib/config to inc/meta-config
and this breaks the to VPN functional jobs, which source this file in
the gate_hook.sh script.

This is a quick fix to get the jobs working again. A future commit can
consider updating gate_hook.sh (as I see that Neutron repo is using a
different script now).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162784/

Change-Id: I298b302ea4860e23acad10087a4ebe0783780826

commit_message:
Break coupling between ML2 and L3 during create/update operations

This is an initial patch in a series that, by using an event framework,
cleans up the relationship between ML2 and L3, so that they are no longer
tightly coupled. A follow-up will take address the coupling during the
port delete operation.

The newly introduced notification hooks not only benefit the L3 service
plugin, but any other plugin that has an interest in knowing about port
events.

Long term, the notification bits can move in a more 'common' place so that
other plugins can take advantage of them, but as mentioned in a parent patch,
the perestroika is not quite there yet.

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: I6527b1cb53a71a1f68329a7a3b1878094558f8c2

One of tests creates share network and then share based on it. Both have
default values for cleanup order - either in after test method or after whole
test suite. Default value for share is deletion afer test suite, but for
share network is after test method. That caused errors for clean up.

commit_message:
Fix cleanup order for tempest test

One of tests creates share network and then share based on it. Both have
default values for cleanup order - either in after test method or after whole
test suite. Default value for share is deletion afer test suite, but for
share network is after test method. That caused errors for clean up.

Change-Id: I5a33bc5adc3a9aa84f9ce0dd6a5df204c5bb7452

commit_message:
Remove FK on service_id and make service_id nullable

Now that we are sure that there are no longer queries to the
compute/service relationship, we can safely remove the foreign key.

Change-Id: I779a4ce9c3e1ebcd6ea1b7124c6b06bd129e7015
Implements: blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

commit_message:
Allow passing 'many_handler' to fetch_all function

When many values are found for a given result a callback
is called to determine what to return. To match the fetch
routine allow for the fetch_all function to pass along a
handler (and default to one that is the existing behavior)
so that people can extract there own values (if they so
choose).

Change-Id: I8c105e1a810e8e0c2c210613506c9ce59021009d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 02:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/base.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/base.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/task.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runtime.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/actions/retry.py'], 'message': 'Allow the storage unit to use the right scoping strategy

Instead of having the fetch arguments functions need to be
provided a scope walker to correctly find the right arguments,
which only the internals of the action engine know about
provide a default scope walker (that is the same one the
action engine internal uses) to the storage unit and have it be
the default strategy used so that users need not know how to
pass it in (which they should not care about).

This allows for users to fetch the same mapped arguments as the
internals of the engine will fetch.

Change-Id: I1beca532b2b7c7ad98b09265a0c4477658052d16
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the storage unit to use the right scoping strategy

Instead of having the fetch arguments functions need to be
provided a scope walker to correctly find the right arguments,
which only the internals of the action engine know about
provide a default scope walker (that is the same one the
action engine internal uses) to the storage unit and have it be
the default strategy used so that users need not know how to
pass it in (which they should not care about).

This allows for users to fetch the same mapped arguments as the
internals of the engine will fetch.

Change-Id: I1beca532b2b7c7ad98b09265a0c4477658052d16

commit_message:
Set default of api_workers to number of CPUs

The current default for api_workers is 0.  This patch changes it to
use the number of CPUs available, which is the default that will
provide best performance.  This is consistent with some other
OpenStack service (Nova and Swift, at least, perhaps others).

Note that devstack is updated in another patch to ensure multiple API
workers is being tested for Neutron the same way it's tested for
several other services:

    https://review.openstack.org/140482

Co-Authored-By: Eugene Nikanorov <enikanorov@mirantis.com>
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Change-Id: I4d76baf68b014fc80693f53874734783089abda2

This patch sets exec down to a warning (instead of an error), so
that it is consistent with other possible code execution vectors
like eval.  This also removes a noisy info level message about
general subprocess calls, which will be moved to a separate
plugin soon.  Finally, this sets chmod group executable to a
warning instead of an error, because it is less dangerous since
groups can usually be trusted (somewhat).

Change-Id: I120876389d9395f6b007c051e0535a6b09ef7e63
'}]
commit_message:
Tweaking severity for a few plugins

This patch sets exec down to a warning (instead of an error), so
that it is consistent with other possible code execution vectors
like eval.  This also removes a noisy info level message about
general subprocess calls, which will be moved to a separate
plugin soon.  Finally, this sets chmod group executable to a
warning instead of an error, because it is less dangerous since
groups can usually be trusted (somewhat).

Change-Id: I120876389d9395f6b007c051e0535a6b09ef7e63

Use oslo_db helper that will allow to restart the whole

commit_message:
Refactor retry mechanism used in some DB operations

Use oslo_db helper that will allow to restart the whole
transaction in case it needs a certain operation to be repeated.
This is a workaround for the REPEATABLE READ problem where
retrying logic will not work because queries inside a transation
will not see updates made by other transactions.
So, run every attempt in a separate transaction.

Change-Id: I68f9ae8019879725df58f5da2c83bb699a548255
Closes-Bug: #1382064

subject: Deprecate setting the payload type and encoding
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendiz√°bal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-11 22:46:52.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'barbicanclient/secrets.py', 'barbicanclient/tests/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate setting the payload type and encoding

Deprecate manually setting the payload_content_type and
payload_content_encoding properties of a secret.  With this CR a user of
the client only needs to provide the payload, and the client will figure
out what the correct payload_content_type and payload_content_encoding
values should be.

Setting these properties for the user lets us avoid a lot of weird
behaviors such as the one described in Bug #1419166, and also lets us
avoid errors that happen when a user mismatches the payload and an
incorrect content type.

In the interest of backwards compatibility, these properties are still
usable, but will log deprecation warnings.  They should be removed in a
future version after current users have had enough time to update their
code bases.

Change-Id: Ibfe3ad42e11bd83c002d0f1b69fb8a323a7b6f3d
Closes-Bug: #1419166
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate setting the payload type and encoding

Deprecate manually setting the payload_content_type and
payload_content_encoding properties of a secret.  With this CR a user of
the client only needs to provide the payload, and the client will figure
out what the correct payload_content_type and payload_content_encoding
values should be.

Setting these properties for the user lets us avoid a lot of weird
behaviors such as the one described in Bug #1419166, and also lets us
avoid errors that happen when a user mismatches the payload and an
incorrect content type.

In the interest of backwards compatibility, these properties are still
usable, but will log deprecation warnings.  They should be removed in a
future version after current users have had enough time to update their
code bases.

Change-Id: Ibfe3ad42e11bd83c002d0f1b69fb8a323a7b6f3d
Closes-Bug: #1419166

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 12802, 'name': 'Carl Pecinovsky', 'email': 'csky@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'carl-sky'}, {'_account_id': 12947, 'name': 'Sridhar Venkat', 'email': 'svenkat@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'svenkat'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14532, 'name': 'Gerald McBrearty', 'email': 'gfm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'gfm'}, {'_account_id': 14917, 'name': 'Dave Archer', 'email': 'dwarcher@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'dwarcher'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-13 19:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/storage.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vios.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': "Enhance NPIV connections for attach/detach volume

When attaching multiple volumes to an instance, the NPIV bus should
utilize the same NPIV connection multiple times.  It should do this to
ensure that there are not erroneous paths (and then virtual hardware) to
the VM.  This increases the performance to the VM as well.

This change set modifies how attach/detach work to fulfill that.

The system will now only create a VFC mapping if it does not already
exist.  It also will only delete the mappings upon deletion of the VM
itself (as the VM is what is serving as the host).

This also removes the vios components 'add_vfc_mapping'.  The reason for
this is, as we add complexity and flows (specifically with regard to
dual VIOS), a simple method will not provide the necessary operations.
And instead we need the flexibility in the npiv part to do quick and
other operations.

While this could have been put into the vios method, it would have
driven a lot of the 'npiv' logic down into that method.  Which did not
make sense.

This is also needed because as dual VIOS and multiple physical fabrics
come into play, we'll need to add more logic surrounding that.

Change-Id: I9536a708545fcbec24f7ecca7fe4034b62e20224
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance NPIV connections for attach/detach volume

When attaching multiple volumes to an instance, the NPIV bus should
utilize the same NPIV connection multiple times.  It should do this to
ensure that there are not erroneous paths (and then virtual hardware) to
the VM.  This increases the performance to the VM as well.

This change set modifies how attach/detach work to fulfill that.

The system will now only create a VFC mapping if it does not already
exist.  It also will only delete the mappings upon deletion of the VM
itself (as the VM is what is serving as the host).

This also removes the vios components 'add_vfc_mapping'.  The reason for
this is, as we add complexity and flows (specifically with regard to
dual VIOS), a simple method will not provide the necessary operations.
And instead we need the flexibility in the npiv part to do quick and
other operations.

While this could have been put into the vios method, it would have
driven a lot of the 'npiv' logic down into that method.  Which did not
make sense.

This is also needed because as dual VIOS and multiple physical fabrics
come into play, we'll need to add more logic surrounding that.

Change-Id: I9536a708545fcbec24f7ecca7fe4034b62e20224

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-03-13 16:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/javelin.py'], 'message': 'javelin: implement floating-ip support

Consider multi-node environment when use_floatingip_for_ssh is True, so
we can run Javelin in multi-node environment.

* create: If CONF.use_floatingip_for_ssh is at True, we create and associate a
  floating IP to a server.
* check: if the server has a floating IP, we

commit_message:
javelin: implement floating-ip support

Consider multi-node environment when use_floatingip_for_ssh is True, so
we can run Javelin in multi-node environment.

* create: If CONF.use_floatingip_for_ssh is at True, we create and associate a
  floating IP to a server.
* check: if the server has a floating IP, we
  validate the server connectivity with it.
* destroy: disassociate the floating IP from the server.

This feature is useful when namespaces are
not reachable from the node where we run Javelin2.

Change-Id: I6c6d998588621b503bda941b54cd5c752eefb684

Move oslo.vmware into test-requirements.txt

The oslo_vmware package is only imported in the vmwareapi virt driver
code (and tests) so it's purely optional if you're using the vmware
driver or not, so move it to test-requirements.txt.

This allows the agent to call a method on all hardware managers
that support the hardware and return a list of their responses. This
will be useful for implementing get_clean_steps() in cleaning.

Also fixes a leaky test in dispatch_to_managers. The function
wrapper was holding global state, which leaked into other tests

commit_message:
Add dispatch to all managers

This allows the agent to call a method on all hardware managers
that support the hardware and return a list of their responses. This
will be useful for implementing get_clean_steps() in cleaning.

Also fixes a leaky test in dispatch_to_managers. The function
wrapper was holding global state, which leaked into other tests
if a function was called again later, messing up the call count.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states
Change-Id: I76bf8ec18df1dc16c4b9d942800b8a1efcde9e65

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-13 15:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Add shadow table empty verification

The ArchiveDatabase tests only test that expected content is moved
into shadow tables. They don't check that unexpected content in
unrelated tables *is not moved*. Like... instance_types. The lack of
this test allowed a regression to get in that could corrupt your
entire database.

This adds an _assert_shadow_tables_empty_except function that should
be called at the end of archiving db tests that asserts that there is
not content in any of the shadow_tables except the ones we expect.

Closes-Bug: #1431571

Change-Id: I49431c5413cc700c46d28ee47a9ed678987f17ff
"}]
commit_message:
Add shadow table empty verification

The ArchiveDatabase tests only test that expected content is moved
into shadow tables. They don't check that unexpected content in
unrelated tables *is not moved*. Like... instance_types. The lack of
this test allowed a regression to get in that could corrupt your
entire database.

This adds an _assert_shadow_tables_empty_except function that should
be called at the end of archiving db tests that asserts that there is
not content in any of the shadow_tables except the ones we expect.

Closes-Bug: #1431571

commit_message:
Add @wrap_exception() for 3 compute functions

currently volume_snapshot_delete, volume_snapshot_create,
get_console_pool_info are rpc calls
but not wrapped with @wrap_exception()
wrap_exception is used to send a notification that an
exception happened for monitoring systems to collect,
which is very useful so we need to wrap it.

Change-Id: I5ce5c73b1d8d159496a1382cc182c9c9a27f01b8

subject: Smarter Create/Delete in BIND9/Agent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 741, 'name': 'Kiall Mac Innes', 'email': 'kiall@macinnes.ie', 'username': 'kiall'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 8174, 'name': 'Tim Simmons', 'email': 'tim.r.simmons@gmail.com', 'username': 'TimSimmons'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-13 14:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['designate/agent/handler.py', 'designate/backend/impl_bind9.py'], 'message': "Smarter Create/Delete in BIND9/Agent

* In BIND9, an rndc addzone fails if the zone already exists,
  similarly, a delzone fails if the zone doesn't exist. This
  patch catches that in the output from the RNDC call, and allows
  the Pool Manager to realize success in the above situation.

* In the Agent, we must take action (write a zone file, for example)
  before we execute the addzone/delzone. So we check with an SOA query
  before the backend is called.

Partial-Bug: 1430976
Change-Id: I0430c3a402ae30d5705bbfef1a4394772cbc12f9
"}]
commit_message:
Smarter Create/Delete in BIND9/Agent

* In BIND9, an rndc addzone fails if the zone already exists,
  similarly, a delzone fails if the zone doesn't exist. This
  patch catches that in the output from the RNDC call, and allows
  the Pool Manager to realize success in the above situation.

* In the Agent, we must take action (write a zone file, for example)
  before we execute the addzone/delzone. So we check with an SOA query
  before the backend is called.

Partial-Bug: 1430976
Change-Id: I0430c3a402ae30d5705bbfef1a4394772cbc12f9

subject: Prefer policy to policy_index
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-13 02:33:27.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/info.py', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/common/test_request_helpers.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_sender.py', 'swift/obj/mem_server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/mem_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/obj/updater.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Prefer policy to policy_index

When a policy must be associated with an operation (particularly in
a method/function signature), adopt the convention of using the
policy instance (instead of just the policy_index).

This puts the earnest on the caller to make the decision if it can
safely assume the legacy policy was intended.

 * added StoragePolicyCollection.legacy property to name the legacy Policy-0

On the wire operations will still prefer the policy_index (normally
provided in the X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index header).  If the
called service can not translate the provided policy index to a
valid policy it should return a client error.

 * object-server will return 400 Bad Request for unknown policy
 * ssync_reciever will raise HTTPBadRequest for unknown policy

The DiskFile API now requires ObjectController.get_diskfile (and
it's derivitives, from_hash and from_audit_location) to accept the
policy instead of the policy index.  Implementations of DiskFile
that previously expected the policy_idx keyword parameter will need
to be modified to accept the policy instance.  It is still possible
to ignore policy (e.g.  swift.obj.mem_diskfile), but creating a
swift.obj.diskfile.DiskFile always requires a policy and will raise
a TypeError if called directly with policy=None.

The Auditor will skip audit locations for unknown policies (like the
updater and replicator) to avoid potentially quarantining objects it
doesn't know how how to property audit - it will still log a warning
when it encounters a datadir for an unknown policy - but it will not
attempt to audit locations in that datadir.

Change-Id: Ic02e46dd8a9312588fb65091fc0a58bf39f80102
"}]
commit_message:
Prefer policy to policy_index

When a policy must be associated with an operation (particularly in
a method/function signature), adopt the convention of using the
policy instance (instead of just the policy_index).

This puts the earnest on the caller to make the decision if it can
safely assume the legacy policy was intended.

 * added StoragePolicyCollection.legacy property to name the legacy Policy-0

On the wire operations will still prefer the policy_index (normally
provided in the X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index header).  If the
called service can not translate the provided policy index to a
valid policy it should return a client error.

 * object-server will return 400 Bad Request for unknown policy
 * ssync_reciever will raise HTTPBadRequest for unknown policy

The DiskFile API now requires ObjectController.get_diskfile (and
it's derivitives, from_hash and from_audit_location) to accept the
policy instead of the policy index.  Implementations of DiskFile
that previously expected the policy_idx keyword parameter will need
to be modified to accept the policy instance.  It is still possible
to ignore policy (e.g.  swift.obj.mem_diskfile), but creating a
swift.obj.diskfile.DiskFile always requires a policy and will raise
a TypeError if called directly with policy=None.

The Auditor will skip audit locations for unknown policies (like the
updater and replicator) to avoid potentially quarantining objects it
doesn't know how how to property audit - it will still log a warning
when it encounters a datadir for an unknown policy - but it will not
attempt to audit locations in that datadir.

Change-Id: Ic02e46dd8a9312588fb65091fc0a58bf39f80102

commit_message:
Add "Preview Stack" action to Stacks table

This patch set adds "Preview Stack" button to Stacks table
to provide user with a possibility to preview stack without
creating it, as it is already implemented in CLI.

Partially implements blueprint: heat-ui-improvement

Change-Id: Idf92deb57f8213a403f102db467828087d91e79a

libvirt: add in missing translation for exception

The exception InvalidInput was missing a translation.

commit_message:
Increase the seed wait_for network timeout

At only 10 seconds I'm seeing occasional timeouts
on this seed network wait_for. Increasing to 20
seems to reliably solve it for me.

Change-Id: I5a902c2aa0f8b09354d14a47071b75a5e9c3e40d

commit_message:
Add localboot support for uefi boot mode

This commit adds localboot support for uefi boot mode.
For uefi localboot, we switch partition table to gpt
and create a efi system partition. The efi system partition
is used later by bootloader (which is installed from
ramdisk).

Corresponding diskimage-builder change is here:
Idf7ac5987e14e1d31311834196ca7283deec15c6

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: I00ac31da325676ea4ea1ac4185f5ac3a52c5809a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 13997, 'name': 'SHIGEMATSU Mitsuhiro', 'email': 'shigematsu.mitsuhiro@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'pshige'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-07 14:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Add support for Fedora 21 image downloads

The Fedora 21 image doesn't have any updates so our existing
TOCI download script doesn't work there yet. This patch
updates the Fedora download logic such that if an updated
image exists it is used. Otherwise we download the Fedora
release image from cloud.fedoraproject.org.

DIB_RELEASE is now required to be explicitly set when using the
new function so that was defaulted to Fedora 20 (for now).

Change-Id: Ib3ea92ae17884251d86888e5f035f67025a155fa
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Fedora 21 image downloads

The Fedora 21 image doesn't have any updates so our existing
TOCI download script doesn't work there yet. This patch
updates the Fedora download logic such that if an updated
image exists it is used. Otherwise we download the Fedora
release image from cloud.fedoraproject.org.

DIB_RELEASE is now required to be explicitly set when using the
new function so that was defaulted to Fedora 20 (for now).

Change-Id: Ib3ea92ae17884251d86888e5f035f67025a155fa

commit_message:

This effectively skips 20-neutron-selinux which currently fails
to run cleanly (even if SELinux is disabled).

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-13 18:43:43.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/environment.py'], 'message': 'Remove killall and timeout for sync over ntp

Delete kilall ntp and start ntp over timeout
for case if we sync time before crm is ready,
like in granular deployment tests.
In those case killall and timeout ntp leads to
situation to un-normal ntp interaption, so that
sync time hangs

Change-Id: I027f94bbfd18684e6c3596cc83e5026a955687fc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove killall and timeout for sync over ntp

Delete kilall ntp and start ntp over timeout
for case if we sync time before crm is ready,
like in granular deployment tests.
In those case killall and timeout ntp leads to
situation to un-normal ntp interaption, so that
sync time hangs

Change-Id: I027f94bbfd18684e6c3596cc83e5026a955687fc

commit_message:
Use assertFalse or assertTrue instead of assertIs

Since `assertFalse` and `assertTrue` are provided for asserting
boolean expression, it is not formal to use `assertIs`.

This patch is continuation of review 162570 as suggested by David Stanek
and Dave Chen to address `assertIs` replacement.

Change-Id: Ief8af6dd1ff59863cc2cbd62aebc75a317781fb3

commit_message:
Set default GW to management VIP on virtual router

Neutron, HA mode: default GW should be set to management VIP on virtual router
when no br-ex is present on node.
assign_vip() is refactored slightly.

Closes-Bug: #1430774
Change-Id: Ibb54242b4c84f44c2623e64f20859296b7acca78

Methods that return a list of entities are named
list_<entity-name>s throughout the project. For
example: list_projects and list_users.

In the Revoke API, the method to list revocation
events was called get_events(). This patch
renames it to list_events(), in order to keep
consistency.

Change-Id: I1032916201a46476b92b44aa7fbcffdcb072f6ea
'}]
commit_message:
Rename get_events to list_events on the Revoke API

Methods that return a list of entities are named
list_<entity-name>s throughout the project. For
example: list_projects and list_users.

In the Revoke API, the method to list revocation
events was called get_events(). This patch
renames it to list_events(), in order to keep
consistency.

Change-Id: I1032916201a46476b92b44aa7fbcffdcb072f6ea

commit_message:
Initial attach/detach volume support

This change set provides the initial support required for attaching and
detaching volumes.

A future change set will be needed to support checking for RMC state or
VM state.  That will be coordinated with a change in pypowervm.

Change-Id: Id14cee922728aeea1002f33707915f19b878938c

commit_message:
Updated transfer tables

The updated transfer tables now provide a warning
popover that appears if the user clicks a disabled
allocated button. The popover contains a message and
link to expand the details for the row. Popover should
dismiss on click elsewhere. A warning icon now shows
on the bottom right of the disabled button.

This patch also includes:
  - cleanup allocate section to hide count for single allocation
  - cleanup of directive code and documentation
  - cleanup of table CSS and transfer table CSS
  - moved re-order column to first column (if applicable)
  - addition of IrDragNDrop to hz-table
  - updated tests

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Icf2046a9e620a8a0efb2bdc7a7ddb18f6445a20f

commit_message:
Use the oslo.policy package

oslo.policy is no longer in incubation. This updates the policy code
accordingly.

There is most likely a better way to use oslo.policy's API, but this
change is mean to provide a direct update with minimal changes.

Change-Id: I434999e4555f13a55f2167f8c212e2712f10eeea
Implements: blueprint oslo-policy-migration

and blows up if you don't have a database connection.

To recreate, run nova.tests.unit.network.test_neutronv2.\
TestNeutronv2WithMock.\
test_deallocate_for_instance_uses_delete_helper with

Change-Id: I32d54d118a5a743d97dcd5751700fb417a29d5c2

commit_message:
Revert "Make unit tests inherit from test.NoDBTestCase"

This reverts commit 92074e0fde7da6262897b08d100fedcfe7e4940f

At least the test_neutronv2.py tests aren't all ready for
this because they have network info refresh cache code that
calls nova.objects.Instance.save() which isn't mocked out
and blows up if you don't have a database connection.

To recreate, run nova.tests.unit.network.test_neutronv2.\
TestNeutronv2WithMock.\
test_deallocate_for_instance_uses_delete_helper with
--concurrency=1.

Change-Id: I32d54d118a5a743d97dcd5751700fb417a29d5c2
Closes-Bug: #1431519

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-13 16:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Change dogpile cache defaults

Memory cache can grow unbounded, so it should really be opt in. Change
to match shade with the following defaults:
 - If you specify nothing, you get null cache
 - If you specify an expiration time and nothing else, you get memory
   cache
 - If you specify an explicit cache class, you will get that class

Change-Id: I6c9eab71a88a534de7e52ad2a564450c44aacc1d
'}]
commit_message:
Change dogpile cache defaults

Memory cache can grow unbounded, so it should really be opt in. Change
to match shade with the following defaults:
 - If you specify nothing, you get null cache
 - If you specify an expiration time and nothing else, you get memory
   cache
 - If you specify an explicit cache class, you will get that class

Change-Id: I6c9eab71a88a534de7e52ad2a564450c44aacc1d

In case we have any interface down (like generic bond0 interface),
we fail with 'undefined method each for nil:NilClass' error in the
middle of _master_ip_and_mac method. And it can happen before we
find needed info thus failing to update Nailgun.

So we just need to skip interfaces that do not have 'addresses'

Closes-bug: #1429807
